title: Story Tone Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of tone descriptors for narrative content within The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each tone (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

adventurous.description: Exciting, focused on exploration and discovery, with an emphasis on action and the unknown.

bleak.description: Hopeless, stark, and devoid of optimism, presenting a grim view of events or existence.

comedic.description: Humorous and amusing, intended to evoke laughter or lighthearted entertainment.

cynical.description: Distrustful of human sincerity or goodness, often presenting characters or situations with skepticism.

dark.description: Focusing on disturbing aspects of human nature or society, often with morbid or pessimistic undertones.

disturbing.description: Unsettling and uncomfortable, designed to provoke unease or distress in the audience.

dramatic.description: Characterized by intense emotions, conflicts, or serious situations with significant stakes.

dreamy.description: Surreal, ethereal, or reminiscent of dreams with fluid reality and evocative imagery.

epic.description: Grand in scale, heroic, and significant, often involving sweeping narratives or world-changing events.

hopeful.description: Expressing belief in positive possibilities or outcomes despite challenges or obstacles.

horrific.description: Designed to invoke fear, dread, or disgust, often featuring supernatural or extreme human darkness.

inspirational.description: Uplifting and motivating, often showcasing triumph over adversity or positive transformations.

introspective.description: Focused on internal thoughts, personal growth, and self-examination of characters.

ironic.description: Using contrast between expectation and reality for effect, often with elements contrary to what might be expected.

lighthearted.description: Cheerful and carefree, avoiding serious or weighty themes in favor of enjoyment and amusement.

melancholic.description: Tinged with sorrow or thoughtful sadness, often reflective about loss or the passage of time.

mysterious.description: Enigmatic and puzzling, featuring unknown elements or secrets that drive curiosity and intrigue.

nihilistic.description: Expressing the belief that life is meaningless or that traditional values lack foundation.

nostalgic.description: Evoking fond memories or longing for the past, often with bittersweet emotional undertones.

optimistic.description: Emphasizing positive aspects of situations and characters' ability to overcome challenges.

paranoid.description: Characterized by suspicion, fear of conspiracy, and a sense that unseen forces control events.

philosophical.description: Contemplative and thought-provoking, exploring deeper questions about existence, ethics, or society.

romantic.description: Focusing on love, passion, and emotional connections between characters.

satirical.description: Using irony, humor, or exaggeration to criticize or comment on societal issues or human flaws.

serious.description: Straightforward and earnest, addressing topics with gravity and minimal levity.

somber.description: Serious and grave in tone, often subdued and reflecting on weighty matters.

suspenseful.description: Creating tension through uncertainty about outcomes, with emphasis on anticipation.

tense.description: Maintaining high levels of anxiety, pressure, or strain throughout the narrative.

tragic.description: Depicting downfall, suffering, or catastrophe, often focusing on characters' flaws or fate.

uplifting.description: Raising spirits and creating positive emotional responses through hopeful or triumphant elements.

whimsical.description: Playfully quaint or fanciful, often with unusual or capricious elements that create wonder.
